questions.text: Identify the nerve root(s) of the thickened nerve marked by the arrow in the image shown below?
Wernicke’s area is situated in the:
Which of these is not a type of synovial joint?
Which among the following is incorrect regarding Sibson's fascia?

options.label: A
options.text: Attached to the inner border of 2nd rib

questions.correct_answer: A. Attached to the inner border of 2nd rib
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Attached to the inner border of 2nd rib

questions.text: A 45-year-old man presents with sudden severe chest pain. He has a history of hypertension, and you suspect aortic dissection. An urgent CT scan shows a widened aorta with a false lumen but no obvious signs of rupture. You note to your consultant that the dissection extends to the level of the aortic opening of the diaphragm, and express your concern about possible damage to all the structures that pass through the aortic opening of the diaphragm. These structures include all of the following except :
What is the function of the muscle marked in the image below, at the metacarpophalangeal joint?

Following surgery for varicose veins, the patient is experiencing a complaint of sensory loss in the medial area of the leg and foot. Which of the following nerves is the most probable site of injury?
Identify the cartilage shown below:
During a yawn, a student experienced a jaw-locking incident. Identify the muscle attached to the articular disc of the temporomandibular joint:
A patient was undergoing clinical evaluation during which the marked structure was stimulated. Which of the following nerves was being tested?
Which nerve innervates the marked muscle?

options.label: C
options.text: From the dorsal rami of C1

questions.text: All the following are true about the right coronary artery except:

options.label: A
options.text: Its diameter is less than left coronary artery

options.label: B
options.text: It arises from the anterior aortic sinus

options.label: C
options.text: It gives rise to circumflex coronary branch

options.label: D
options.text: Right conus artery is its first branch

questions.correct_answer: C. It gives rise to circumflex coronary branch
questions.explanation: Ans. C) It gives rise to circumflex coronary branch

questions.text: All of the following structures are derived from the aponeurosis of the external oblique muscle except:
Identify the marked cell from the given histological image of cerebellum:
Which of the following is not a projection from a bone surface?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Trabeculae

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Trabeculae are internal bone structures that do not project from the surface, unlike trochanters, tubercles, and tuberosities, which are surface projections used for muscle and ligament attachment.
  • ➤ Trabeculae

questions.text: A 40-year-old male patient was admitted with complaints of acute pain in the right shoulder of three-days duration associated with swelling and he also had difficulty in using his right shoulder since then. Pain was sudden at onset, continuous, and moderate to severe in intensity and it was aggravated on activity. In addition, he had severe night and rest pain. He also gave a history of intramuscular injection of Iron in the right deltoid region 2 weeks previously, which was administered in a local clinic. On examination, there was a globular swelling in the lateral aspect of the right arm extending up to the scapular region. There was a local rise of temperature and tenderness over the swelling, painful restriction of the right shoulder movements and he could not abduct his arm to the right angle. MRI scan of the right shoulder showed pyomyositis of the posterior belly of the right deltoid muscle with central abscess formation. Which among the following is not a possible complication that can be expected in this case if untreated? Loss of sensation on lower lateral aspect of arm

options.label: A
options.text: Loss of sensation on lower lateral aspect of arm

options.label: C
options.text: Weak of flexion of arm at shoulder joint

options.label: D
options.text: Inability to extend the arm at shoulder joint

questions.correct_answer: A. Loss of sensation on lower lateral aspect of arm
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Loss of sensation on lower lateral aspect of arm

questions.text: Injury to the nerve that lies medially to the structure pointed will result in

options.label: A
options.text: Loss of taste sensation from anterior 2/3 tongue

options.label: B
options.text: Loss of taste sensation from posterior 1/3 tongue

options.label: C
options.text: Loss of general sensation from anterior 2/3 tongue

options.label: D
options.text: Loss of taste sensation from posterior most part of tongue

questions.correct_answer: A. Loss of taste sensation from anterior 2/3 tongue
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Loss of taste sensation from anterior 2/3 tongue

questions.text: A patient presents with a unilateral throbbing headache, photophobia, and excessive lacrimation. He also complains of hemifacial pain on clenching of teeth. On examination, pupillary reflex, light reflex, and accommodation reflex are normal. Which of the following marked nerves is involved in the above scenario?
Identify the papillae from the given histological section?
Which of the following describes the movements known as pronation and supination?

options.label: A
options.text: The flexing of the arm with respect to the forearm around the elbow.

options.label: B
options.text: The elevation of the foot to the medial and lateral directions.

options.label: C
options.text: The twisting of the wrist while the elbow is held motionless.

options.label: D
options.text: The rotation at the shoulder that causes the arm to describe a cone shape.

questions.correct_answer: C. The twisting of the wrist while the elbow is held motionless.
questions.explanation: Ans. C) The twisting of the wrist while the elbow is held motionless.

questions.text: A 32-year-old man presents to the clinic with complaints of weakness in his right arm after using crutches for six weeks. On examination, he has a deficit in the extension of his wrist and fingers, difficulty with thumb abduction, and diminished sense of touch over the posterior aspect of his arm, forearm, and dorsum of his hand. Which structure is most likely to be affected by the prolonged use of crutches?

A 36-year-old auto driver was attacked and received a stab wound to the front of the neck. The wound was located on the right side, just lateral to the tip of the greater cornu of the hyoid bone. When asked to protrude his tongue, it deviated to the right. Which of the following statements is incorrect regarding the physical signs in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Paralysis of the right genioglossus muscle permitted the left genioglossus to pull the tongue forward and turned the tip to the right side

options.label: B
options.text: Genioglossus originates from the lower genial tubercles of the mandible

options.label: C
options.text: The hypoglossal nerve descends in the neck between the internal carotid artery and the internal jugular vein.

options.label: D
options.text: At about the level of the tip of the greater cornu of the hyoid bone the hypoglossal nerve turns forward and crosses the internal and external carotid arteries and the lingual artery to enter the tongue

questions.correct_answer: B. Genioglossus originates from the lower genial tubercles of the mandible
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Genioglossus originates from the lower genial tubercles of the mandible

questions.text: A 7-year-old boy was brought to the hospital with multiple fractures of the humerus secondary to a fall from height. On examination, there is difficulty in flexion of the elbow and supination of the forearm, along with a loss of sensation over the lateral aspect of the forearm. Which nerve is most likely to be injured?
Identify the sensory nerve supply for the given area of the hand?

A 5-month-old girl was brought to the casualty with seizures. The pediatrician tries to perform a CSF sampling. What are the structures punctured by the pediatrician while piercing through the anterior fontanelle?

A 35-year-old male, diagnosed with squint, presented to the ophthalmology department for a regular checkup. On examination, a marked muscle was found affected. At which level does the nerve supply for the marked structure arise?

Which of the following are branches of the anterior division of the internal iliac artery? Superior gluteal artery Inferior gluteal artery Superior vesical artery Middle rectal artery Inferior vesical artery Vaginal artery

A patient, Vinod, who has taken the first COVID vaccine comes for the second dose. A nurse noticed that the shoulder was flabby, flat, and asymmetrical. There was an associated loss of contour of the shoulder joint. Injury to which of the structures might have resulted and was avoidable?

options.label: C
options.text: Lateral cutaneous nerve of the arm

questions.text: Fibers from the marked structure end in which of the following areas of the thalamus?

A 75-year-old male presented with a history of frequency, hesitancy, and urgency for urination. He was on medication with Tamsulosin and Finasteride. Now, Trans Urethral Resection of Prostate (TURP) surgery was recommended by the physician. What is the volume of the prostate in normal adult males?
Which structure from the options given below is supplied by the nerve that arises from the marked area in the image?
Which is not a branch of the facial artery?
Which of the following structures passing via the jugular foramen has a separate canal?

A young man presenting with features of recurrent brief depressive disorder, each lasting for about 3 to 7 days, for over a year. He had a history of occasional headaches and episodes of swooning attacks in between, usually precipitated by emotional events. His neuroimaging revealed agenesis of corpus callosum. He was experiencing swooning attacks as he became aware that some ‘unusual’ findings were present in his reports. Recurrent brief depression can be a manifestation of this congenital anomaly, and conversion disorder can be present as a comorbid diagnosis, perhaps due to ignorance and fear of this apparently innocuous congenital malformation. What is the blood supply of corpus callosum?

options.label: A
options.text: Anterior cerebral artery and middle cerebral artery

options.label: B
options.text: Anterior cerebral artery and posterior cerebral artery

options.label: C
options.text: Anterior cerebral artery and anterior communicating artery

options.label: D
options.text: Middle cerebral artery and posterior cerebral artery

questions.correct_answer: C. Anterior cerebral artery and anterior communicating artery
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Anterior cerebral artery and anterior communicating artery

questions.text: A patient age 45 presented with difficulty in foot eversion and sensory loss on the lateral leg and dorsum of the foot. The nerve injured is:

A 67-year-old lady, Janki, presented with loss of subconscious kinesthetic sensation, loss of pain and temperature sensation, as well as loss of crude touch from the body. On examination, fine touch sensation was found to be normal. In case of spinal angiography, blockage of which of the following arteries might be seen?

A 40-year-old female, Vimla, presented after a road traffic accident with a brief loss of consciousness. On general examination, she exhibited fatigue, pallor, and weakness. She also had mild jaundice and gallstones, with massive hepatosplenomegaly and hypersplenism. Skull radiography revealed widening of the diploic spaces. Her medical history includes failure to thrive in early childhood, growth retardation, delayed puberty, leg ulcers, and skin bronzing. Following the accident, she now has a headache, lucid interval, nausea, vomiting, and focal neurological deficits. Plain X-ray shows a skull fracture, and a CT scan reveals hyperdense biconvex opacity in the temporal region. What is your single best diagnosis for the current presentation?

A patient, Ramlal, a 56-year-old male, presented with a history of palanaesthesia, astereognosis, loss of proprioception, and loss of fine touch sensation. He has a chronic history of smoking, diabetes, and hypertension. In the case of spinal angiography, blockage of which of the following arteries might be seen?

A 50-year-old male, Jagan, presented with severe headache, vomiting, and a history of immediate unconsciousness. On admission, he was found hypertensive with a history of poorly controlled hypertension. Gradual decline in neurological functions was noted. Neck stiffness and a positive Kernig’s sign were found. An NCCT scan failed to make a diagnosis. A lumbar puncture (LP) revealed grossly bloody cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) with RBC counts up to 1 million/cu mm. After 48 hours, xanthochromic spinal fluid was found. What is your single best diagnosis?
In adults, lumbar puncture is done at?

A 35-year-old alcoholic and chronic smoker male, Amit, with a history of hypercholesterolemia for 8 years, presented to the OPD with hemiplegia on the right side of his body. On examination, he had loss of proprioception, fine touch, and vibration sensations on the right side. He was also unable to recognize objects with his right hand when his eyes were closed (astereognosis). On further examination, his tongue was found to be atrophied on the left side with deviation to the left upon protrusion. Cerebral angiography revealed blockage of an artery located in the median fissure of the spinal cord at the lower part of the brainstem. What is your diagnosis?
Handlebar palsy occurs due to compression of which nerve?
Which nerve is cut in Vidian’s Neurectomy?
In the given MRI image, identify the marked structure.
Blockage of the artery supplying the indicated area will cause all except?

A patient is unable to hold paper between his 4th and 5th fingers. He is also unable to flex the distal interphalangeal joints of the same fingers. These symptoms are likely due to damage at which of the following sites in the given humerus image?
Superior, inferior, and facial colliculus are indicated respectively as?
Identify the correct options with indicated structures.

options.label: A
options.text: A-anterior cerebral artery, B-ICA, C-infundibulum, D-Posterior communicating artery, E-III nerve, F-IV nerve

options.label: B
options.text: A-anterior communicating artery, B-ICA, C-Infundibulum, D-posterior communicating artery, E-III nerve, F-IV nerve

options.label: C
options.text: A-anterior cerebral artery, B-ICA, C-Infundibulum, D-posterior communicating artery, E-IV nerve, F-V nerve

options.label: D
options.text: A-anterior communicating artery, B-ICA, C-Infundibulum, D-posterior communicating artery, E-III nerve, F-V nerve

questions.correct_answer: B. A-anterior communicating artery, B-ICA, C-Infundibulum, D-posterior communicating artery, E-III nerve, F-IV nerve
questions.explanation: Ans. B) A-anterior communicating artery, B-ICA, C-Infundibulum, D-posterior communicating artery, E-III nerve, F-IV nerve

questions.text: Graveyard of the ulnar nerve is.
Identify the vertebra.
Identify the Honeymoon muscle.

A 48-year-old female patient presented with recurrent episodes of severe abdominal pain, which is often accompanied by nausea and vomiting. Upper gastrointestinal endoscopy reveals multiple peptic ulcers in the duodenal bulb. Laboratory tests show elevated gastrin levels. She was given Prilosec for a long time. She was also consuming a vegetarian diet and now presented with tiredness & palpitations for a month. She complained of progressive sensory loss in her lower extremities. Neurological examination reveals impaired vibratory sensation in both legs. An MRI of the spinal cord shows no structural abnormalities. On blood examination, she had the following hematological slide. All of the following statements are correct in this case except:

options.label: A
options.text: This is a case of gastrinoma with high gastrin secretion resulting in hypersecretion of hydrochloric acid.

options.label: B
options.text: Prilosec is an example of a proton pump inhibitor which may cause decreased Vit B12 absorption.

options.label: C
options.text: In this patient, due to Vitamin B12 deficiency, myelination of the anterior spinothalamic tract has been affected.

options.label: D
options.text: On hematological examination, increased mean corpuscular volume (MCV, >100 fL) and mean corpuscular hemoglobin (MCH) and polymorphonuclear cells with multiple lobes are found.

questions.correct_answer: C. In this patient, due to Vitamin B12 deficiency, myelination of the anterior spinothalamic tract has been affected.
questions.explanation: Ans. C) In this patient, due to Vitamin B12 deficiency, myelination of the anterior spinothalamic tract has been affected.

questions.text: A 61-year-old male presents to the neurology clinic with a complaint of tremors and difficulty with movement. He reports that over the past year, he has noticed a gradual slowing down of his movements, stiffness in his limbs, and a persistent tremor in his right hand. His family members have also observed that his handwriting has become smaller and less legible. Additionally, he has experienced some balance problems and has had several falls in the last few months. On further inquiry, he mentions that he occasionally experiences a shuffling gait and finds it challenging to initiate and sustain his walking. Deficiency in synthesis of a particular neurotransmitter leads to this situation. This particular neurotransmitter is produced in which of the sites marked below?

A 23-year-old female presents to the emergency room with complaints of severe headaches and visual disturbances for the past week. She describes the headaches as throbbing in nature, located mainly around her temples and forehead. The visual disturbances include blurred vision and seeing "flashing lights" in her peripheral vision. She has no significant medical history but mentions that her brother has a history of similar symptoms. On detailed neurological examination, bilateral papilledema was observed on fundoscopic examination. Further evaluation, including neuroimaging, confirms the presence of an intracranial mass. The radiologist takes measurements and identifies the location of the mass relative to the patient's skull using a reference point known as Frankfurt’s plane. This plane passes through?

options.label: A
options.text: Supraorbital margin and upper margin of external acoustic meatus

options.label: B
options.text: Supraorbital margin and lower margin of external acoustic meatus

options.label: C
options.text: Infraorbital margin and upper margin of external acoustic meatus

options.label: D
options.text: Infraorbital margin and lower margin of external acoustic meatus

questions.correct_answer: C. Infraorbital margin and upper margin of external acoustic meatus
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Infraorbital margin and upper margin of external acoustic meatus

questions.text: A 35-year-old male presents to the orthopedic clinic with complaints of shoulder pain and weakness in his right arm for the past several weeks. He reports that the pain is most severe when he tries to lift objects or reach overhead. Physical examination reveals tenderness in the anterior aspect of the shoulder, and the patient demonstrates weakness in flexing his right arm against resistance. Which structure is having the highest probability to be affected in this case?

A 42-year-old male presents to the emergency department with diplopia. Neurological examination reveals that he has difficulty in looking upward. On radiological examination, a mass was found on the dorsum of the brain, which was compressing a nearby structure. Which of the following statements is true in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Most probably this patient is presenting with a tumour of B, which is causing compression of A, resulting in downward gaze.

options.label: B
options.text: Most probably this patient is presenting with a tumour of C, which is causing compression of B, resulting in downward gaze.

options.label: C
options.text: Most probably this patient is presenting with a tumour of B, which is causing compression of C, resulting in downward gaze.

options.label: D
options.text: Most probably this patient is presenting with a tumour of A, which is causing compression of B, resulting in downward gaze.

questions.correct_answer: D. Most probably this patient is presenting with a tumour of A, which is causing compression of B, resulting in downward gaze.
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Most probably this patient is presenting with a tumor of A, which is causing compression of B, resulting in downward gaze.

questions.text: A 61-year-old woman presents to the emergency department with a complaint of a painful lump in her right groin that has been gradually increasing in size over the past few weeks. She describes the pain as constant and sharp, exacerbated when she coughs or strains. The patient has a history of multiple pregnancies and has noticed a bulge in her groin area when lifting heavy objects. On examination, there is a tender, firm, and irreducible mass in the right femoral region just below the inguinal ligament. The overlying skin appears erythematous. The patient's vital signs are stable. Proper diagnosis was made with all clinical examination and surgical treatment was decided. During this surgery, it became very important to identify the pectineal ligament, lacunar ligament, and inguinal ligament. Identify the ligaments in the image:

options.label: A
options.text: A-Inguinal ligament, B-lacunar ligament, C-Pectineal ligament

options.label: B
options.text: A-Lacunar ligament, B-Inguinal ligament, C-Pectineal ligament

options.label: C
options.text: A-Pectineal ligament, B-Inguinal ligament, C-Lacunar ligament

options.label: D
options.text: A-Inguinal ligament, B-Pectineal ligament, C-Lacunar ligament

questions.correct_answer: D. A-Inguinal ligament, B-Pectineal ligament, C-Lacunar ligament
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) A-Inguinal ligament, B-Pectineal ligament, C-Lacunar ligament

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The inguinal ligament forms the superior boundary of the femoral canal, while the lacunar ligament lies medially, and the pectineal ligament runs along the pecten pubis. These ligaments are critical landmarks in surgeries addressing groin hernias.

questions.text: A 30-year-old woman presents to her obstetrician for a routine prenatal check-up during her first trimester of pregnancy. She is eager to learn about the development of her growing fetus and asks about the early stages of spinal cord formation. The obstetrician explains that during the early 6th week of embryonic life, significant developmental events occur in the cervical region of the spinal cord. These events involve the notochord, a critical structure in embryonic development. Identify the position of the different structures in the image below:

options.label: A
options.text: A - dorsal root ganglion, B – dorsal root of spinal nerve, C – notochord, D – trunk of spinal nerve

options.label: B
options.text: A - ventral root of spinal nerve, B – dorsal root ganglion, C – notochord, D – trunk of spinal nerve

options.label: C
options.text: A - ventral root of spinal nerve, B – dorsal root of spinal nerve, C – notochord, D – trunk of spinal nerve

options.label: D
options.text: A - dorsal root of spinal nerve, B – ventral root of spinal nerve, C – notochord, D – trunk of spinal nerve

questions.correct_answer: D. A - dorsal root of spinal nerve, B – ventral root of spinal nerve, C – notochord, D – trunk of spinal nerve
questions.explanation: Ans. D) A - dorsal root of spinal nerve, B – ventral root of spinal nerve, C – notochord, D – trunk of spinal nerve

questions.text: A patient was presented with exacerbated chronic lower back pain in the sacral region with irradiation to the back of the left leg, producing strong throbbing and burning pain behind the knee. Pain was aggravated when bending forward or reaching out. In his history, he had a back condition from birth and later had an accident that resulted in a fracture of the lumbar vertebrae. His MRI two months prior to this aggravation showed degeneration of L1, disc degeneration, and protrusion of the disc at the S1 level. He was prescribed strong non-steroidal pain medication that made him feel drowsy, but did not provide full pain relief. Seeking resolution for his pain, he decided to try InterX therapy and treatment was aimed at the whole lumbar-sacral zone, dermatomes L1/L2 and L4, L5, S1–S3, left buttock, right buttock, and left back of the knee. After two and a half weeks of use, he reported no pain or discomfort, stopped taking pain medication, and started a core exercise program to stabilize the lumbar spine. Six months of follow-up confirmed that the patient remained pain-free, actively working, and traveling. All of the following anatomical statements are true about this case except:

options.label: A
options.text: A & D arise from the same bony point.

options.label: B
options.text: C runs in between the vein and nerve.

options.label: C
options.text: B is affected in this case due to which all symptoms appeared.

questions.correct_answer: B. C runs in between the vein and nerve.
questions.explanation: Ans. B) C runs in between the vein and nerve.

questions.text: A patient died due to a malignant neck tumor. A neck dissection was done to understand the extent of cancer for research purposes. All of the following statements are true except?

options.label: A
options.text: A emerges from the nerve point behind the sternocleidomastoid, runs superiorly, and divides into anterior & posterior divisions.

options.label: B
options.text: B is the 1st branch of the external carotid artery.

options.label: C
options.text: C is palpable along the lower margin of the mandible in front of the strongest muscle of the body.

options.label: D
options.text: D is showing its activity under the control of the facial nerve.

questions.correct_answer: B. B is the 1st branch of the external carotid artery.
questions.explanation: Ans. B) B is the 1st branch of the external carotid artery.

questions.text: A 21-year-old nulligravida Caucasian patient presented with a 15-month history of amenorrhea, bifrontal headache, and photophobia. Examination revealed general physical, neurologic, and ophthalmoscopic findings with normal visual fields. A pelvic examination revealed normal external genitalia, a nulliparous cervix and uterus, and bilateral cystic ovarian masses measuring 8 cm in diameter on the right and 4 cm on the left. Endocrine evaluation revealed an elevated serum prolactin in the range of 48 to 50 ng/ml. This situation was related to a mass in which of the following areas in the image below?
Choose the incorrect statement regarding the shown bone:

options.label: A
options.text: This is a large, triangular fusion of five vertebrae and forms the posterosuperior wall of the pelvic cavity, wedged between the two innominate bones.

options.label: B
options.text: Its blunted, caudal apex articulates with the coccyx and its superior, wide base with the fifth lumbar vertebra at the lumbosacral angle.

options.label: C
options.text: It is set obliquely and curved longitudinally, the dorsal surface is convex, and the pelvic surface is concave; this ventral curvature increases pelvic capacity.

options.label: D
options.text: In childhood, individual sacral vertebrae are connected by intervertebral discs, and the adult bone retains many vertebral features.

questions.correct_answer: D. In childhood, individual sacral vertebrae are connected by intervertebral discs, and the adult bone retains many vertebral features.
questions.explanation: Ans. D) In childhood, individual sacral vertebrae are connected by intervertebral discs, and the adult bone retains many vertebral features.

questions.text: An 18-year-old gymnast complained of insidious-onset and increasing right-wrist pain. He had been practicing gymnastics six hours a day, three days a week, for the past seven years. Approximately three months before his visit, he began to experience severe pain which worsened with wrist extension. Initially, he thought he had a muscle strain and treated it conservatively with ice packing and decreasing his activity level, but there was little improvement. On physical examination, the patient had a soft callus over the distal wrist. He reported pain in the anatomic snuffbox and in the distal radial epiphysis. Wrist extension was 38° on the right and 60° on the left. The patient’s range of motion was limited to 38° of extension and 12° of radial deviation on the right wrist, but presented no flexion or ulnar deviation limitations. Pronation, supination, and digital motion were within normal limits. All of the following statements are correct regarding this case except:

options.label: A
options.text: The A doesn’t participate in formation of the floor of the anatomical snuff box.

options.label: B
options.text: The B is a small and irregular bone with a rough palmar surface that is narrower and smaller than its rough dorsal surface.

options.label: C
options.text: The C is the largest carpal bone in the proximal carpal row. It has a long axis that is distal, radial, and palmar in direction. In this case, C is fractured where involvement of D also can be seen.

questions.correct_answer: A. The A doesn’t participate in formation of the floor of the anatomical snuff box.
questions.explanation: Ans. A) The A doesn’t participate in formation of the floor of the anatomical snuff box.

questions.text: A 37-year-old patient, a victim of a motorcycle accident, was presented to the emergency room with shortness of breath, pale and unstable, with a heart rate of 155 bpm, 96% O2 saturation, a blood pressure of 90/60 mmHg, and a Glasgow score of 12. The patient presented with blunt abdominal trauma and advanced trauma life support (ATLS) was promptly initiated. The patient was rushed to the operating room and underwent an exploratory laparotomy. An incision was made in the anterior abdominal wall. All of the following statements are true about the anterior abdominal wall structures except:

options.label: A
options.text: A is the largest and most superficial of the three anterolateral abdominal muscles, which is attached to the external surfaces and inferior borders of the distal eight ribs.

options.label: B
options.text: The muscle fibers of B are usually interrupted by one to four tendinous intersections.

options.label: C
options.text: C is located at L3 – L4 vertebral level.

options.label: D
options.text: Modification of D forms the inguinal ligament & lacunar ligament but not the pectineal ligament.

questions.correct_answer: D. Modification of D forms the inguinal ligament & lacunar ligament but not the pectineal ligament.
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Modification of D forms the inguinal ligament & lacunar ligament but not the pectineal ligament.

questions.text: All of the following are correct for the given image except:

options.label: A
options.text: The artery arising from A is usually single, although up to four openings have been observed, reflecting the independent origins of the conal, sinuatrial nodal, and ventricular arteries.

options.label: B
options.text: The artery arising from B is usually larger in calibre than the right and supplies a greater volume of myocardium, including almost all of the right ventricle and atrium, and most of the interventricular septum.

options.label: C
options.text: C is an ear-like muscular projection arising from the chamber where D is the opening.

options.label: D
options.text: D is formed by the union of right & left brachiocephalic veins.

questions.correct_answer: B. The artery arising from B is usually larger in calibre than the right and supplies a greater volume of myocardium, including almost all of the right ventricle and atrium, and most of the interventricular septum.
questions.explanation: Ans. B) The artery arising from B is usually larger in calibre than the right and supplies a greater volume of myocardium, including almost all of the right ventricle and atrium, and most of the interventricular septum.

questions.text: A 42-year-old male presented in the surgery OPD with hematemesis and chronic diffuse pain in the retrosternal area. He has a 21-year history of smoking and alcohol consumption. On examination, the urea breath test was negative. Endoscopic examination revealed a gastric ulcer, and according to modified Johnson’s classification, it was categorized under Type IV. To prevent bleeding, which of the following arteries should be ligated?
Choose the correct option for the image shown.

options.label: A
options.text: A – Neural tube, B – Presomite mesoderm, C – Ectoderm, D – Somite

options.label: B
options.text: A – Neural tube, B – Presomite mesoderm, C – Mesoderm, D – Somite

options.label: C
options.text: A – Neural tube, B – Somite, C – Ectoderm, D – Presomite mesoderm

options.label: D
options.text: A – Neural tube, B – Somite, C – Mesoderm, D – Presomite mesoderm

questions.correct_answer: C. A – Neural tube, B – Somite, C – Ectoderm, D – Presomite mesoderm
questions.explanation: Ans. C) A – Neural tube, B – Somite, C – Ectoderm, D – Presomite mesoderm

questions.text: Choose the correct options for the given image below.

options.label: A
options.text: A – Purkinje layer, B – Granular layer, C – White mater, D – Piamater, E – Blood vessels, F – Molecular layer

options.label: B
options.text: A – Granular layer, B – White mater, C – Piamater, D – Blood vessels, E – Molecular layer, F – Purkinje layer

options.label: C
options.text: A – Molecular layer, B – Purkinje layer, C – Granular layer, D – White mater, E – Piamater, F – Blood vessels

options.label: D
options.text: A – Piamater, B – Purkinje layer, C – Granular layer, D – White mater, E – Molecular layer, F – Blood vessels

questions.correct_answer: C. A – Molecular layer, B – Purkinje layer, C – Granular layer, D – White mater, E – Piamater, F – Blood vessels
questions.explanation: Ans. C) A – Molecular layer, B – Purkinje layer, C – Granular layer, D – White mater, E – Piamater, F – Blood vessels

questions.text: Fabella is present in:
Which is not a cause of positive Trendelenburg sign?
What is the nerve supply of the popliteus muscle?
Which is the muscle marked as A in the femoral triangle?
Locking muscle is?
Which muscle originates from the anterior superior iliac spine?
Which bone in the foot is not attached by any muscle?
Which muscle originates from the ischial tuberosity?
questions.explanation: Ans. D. All of the above (Semimembranosus, Semitendinosus, Adductor magnus)

questions.text: Femoral triangle base is formed by:
Tibial and common peroneal nerve supplies:
Which of the following muscles is an evertor of the foot?
What is true about the iliotibial tract?

options.label: B
options.text: Gluteus medius is inserted into it

options.label: C
options.text: Insertion at medial aspect of tibia

options.label: D
options.text: Runs along the medial aspect of thigh

questions.text: Which muscle is responsible for sitting to standing position?
Gluteus medius is supplied by:
In injury to the neck of fibula, which of the following nerve is usually injured?
During the South Africa test match, Indian captain Rohit Sharma got stretching of muscles at the thigh during running in between the wickets. Which muscles are stretched, known as Runner’s muscles?
What is the nerve root value of the superior gluteal nerve?
What is the root value of the sciatic nerve?
questions.explanation: Ans. B) L4, L5, S1, S2, S3

questions.text: Tibialis posterior muscle is supplied by which nerve?
Mention the type of joint present at the marked region.
Identify the muscle forming the marked boundary.
In the given image, the tendon marked by the arrow is?
Which muscle is attached to the marked bony structure?
Common carotid artery pulse is taken at the level of:
What is the arrangement from near to far of the recti muscles attached towards the limbus?

options.label: A
options.text: Medial rectus, inferior rectus, lateral rectus, superior rectus

options.label: B
options.text: Superior rectus, lateral rectus, inferior rectus, medial rectus

options.label: C
options.text: Medial rectus, lateral rectus, inferior rectus, superior rectus

options.label: D
options.text: Medial rectus, superior rectus, lateral rectus, inferior rectus

questions.correct_answer: A. Medial rectus, inferior rectus, lateral rectus, superior rectus
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Medial rectus, inferior rectus, lateral rectus, superior rectus

questions.text: A 62-year-old patient was brought to the ER following a suspected stroke. The patient was unable to speak fluently, though he understands the given instructions. Which category of aphasia is most likely present in the patient?
While administering epidural anesthesia, which structure is not punctured before injecting the drug?
Identify the marked chamber.
The marked line corresponds to which vertebral level?
Which structure forms the lateral boundary of Hesselbach’s triangle?
Identify the structures marked in numbers.
For the conjoint tendon, all are true except?

options.label: A
options.text: Formed by the internal oblique aponeurosis and transversus abdominis aponeurosis

options.label: B
options.text: Forms the posterior wall of the inguinal canal

options.label: C
options.text: Protects the superficial inguinal ring to maintain the integrity of the inguinal canal

options.label: D
options.text: Runs parallel to the inguinal ligament

questions.correct_answer: D. Runs parallel to the inguinal ligament
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Runs parallel to the inguinal ligament
